column4: hi all. after logging into gnome, my session freezes just after entering my password. All I'm left with is a brown desktop and a mouse pointer. I can run a failsafe terminal, it seems, but not much else. any ideas how to fix it?
is there some way to reset my gnome profile so that it loads properly?
when logging in, choose 'gnome default' as your session
I've tried that and it still does exactly the same thing
what happens when you login with the default session?
anything revealing in ~/.xsession-errors ?
ooh, that sounds like the sort of place I want to look
there doesn't seem to be anything there ringing alarm bells
copying settings files is likely to cause the same problem again. do you get the splash screen come up?
the gdm comes up, but not the splash screen showing what's loading up
if copying settings files causes the same problem, could I not just find the right file to delete and "get rid of the problem"
in theory, yep :)
does /usr/share/xsessions/gnome.desktop have exec=/usr/bin/gnome-session ?
yup
if you login using the failsafe terminal session and run 'gnome-session' in the terminal, does that throw up any ideas?
I'll give it a go. I'll have to exit xchat though (cos it's running from failsafe terminal), so will let you know in a few minutes
thanks for the troubleshooting suggestions, btw, I appreciate it!
minimec, both gnome-session and logging in as a different user gave the same problem :(. Maybe reinstalling gnome is the way to go?
it certainly dosen't sound healthy. reinstalling gnome cant hurt :o
would 'sudo apt-get install -reinstall gnome' do the trick, or is it something like 'ubuntu-desktop' that I need to reinstall?
i'm not sure what package to recommend reinstalling tbh :\
thanks for your help!
